Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Tricyclic peptide RP 71955 (natural AMPs; a class 1 lasso peptide, 2S=S; lactam; XXJ; UCSB1a; bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes, ZZHb)

Literature Information.Literature: Chemical modification: An internal amide bond between the NH2 of C1 and the gamma-COOH of D9 was observed, as well as two disulfide bridges, one between C1 and C13 and one between C7 and C19. In contrast. Class 2 lassos do not have disulfide bonds.Activity: inhibited the HIV-1 aspartyl protease (IC50, 35 ug/ml) aStructure:You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB. UPdated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Helynck G, Dubertret C, Mayaux JF, Leboul J.1993
Literature Information.Title: Isolation of RP 71955, a new anti-HIV-1 peptide secondary metabolite.
